title: Red Lentil Curry Recipe
description: This red lentil curry is a rich and hearty vegetarian curry made with caramelized onions, spices, and tomato puree for a filling and satisfying meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Fruits and Vegetables Beans and Peas Lentils Red Lentil Curry 4.5 (1,442) 1,006 Reviews 126 Photos This red lentil curry is rich and hearty. It's great as a main meal rather than a side dish like the more traditional Indian dhal. Don't let the ingredient list faze you — this is an easy dish to make. This dish is excellent served with basmati rice. Submitted by Emma Maher Updated on August 21, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 126 126 126 126 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 40 mins Total Time: 50 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 2 cups red lentils 3 cups water, or more as needed 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 large onion, diced 2 tablespoons curry paste 1 tablespoon curry powder 1 teaspoon ground turmeric 1 teaspoon ground cumin 1 teaspoon chili powder 1 teaspoon salt 1 teaspoon white sugar 1 teaspoon minced garlic 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger 1 (14.25 ounce) can tomato puree Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Wash lentils in cold water until water runs clear. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Put lentils in a pot with enough water to cover; bring to a boil and reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer, adding water as needed to keep lentils covered, until tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onions in hot oil until caramelized, about 20 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Mix together curry paste, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, salt, sugar, garlic, and ginger in a large bowl; stir into onions. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Increase heat to high and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in tomato puree and lentils; cook until warmed through. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 2,062 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 192 Calories 3g Fat 33g Carbs 12g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 192 % Daily Value * Total Fat 3g 3% Saturated Fat 0g 2% Sodium 572mg 25% Total Carbohydrate 33g 12% Dietary Fiber 11g 40% Total Sugars 7g Protein 12g 24% Vitamin C 9mg 10% Calcium 44mg 3% Iron 6mg 31% Potassium 727mg 15% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Red Lentil Curry 01 of 126 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 126 Photo by  Jedi Chimp 01/07/2024 I made this and was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked it, I added some crushed chilli puree to the spice mix for a cheeky kick, apart from that I didn't change or add anything else 03 of 126 Photo by  mcboak 12/24/2020 04 of 126 Photo by  Clint MC 11/25/2020 05 of 126 Photo by  Tim Durant 11/18/2020 06 of 126 Photo by  Ilic Milorad 11/17/2020 07 of 126 Photo by  Robert Davis 10/08/2020 08 of 126 Photo by  Tabitha Mobley 09/15/2020 This is a really good recipe & a really good curry base to play with. I used regular lentils & ground ginger in lieu of fresh. The only thing I would change would be just a pinch of sugar instead of the called amount (I’m not a fan of sugar). I would also double the onion & garlic as I’m a huge fan of both. Thanks for the recipe! 09 of 126 Photo by  A Ford Brink 08/27/2020 Vegan meal.
